page.title: 06RELIGION IN PENRHYNSIDE
page.content: There are five{chapels}in Penrhyn side. It is nicknamed the{Holy City but hardly anyone goes to chapel now. During the reign of{Queen Elizabeth 1 many Welsh Catholics were loyal to the old faith. The{Pugh Family}who lived in Penrhyn Old Hall continued to practice their religion secretly but in 1582 were outlawed as{Recusants.} The fine for not attending Anglican services was Â£20 per month. At this time a cave on the Little Orme -{Ty yn {y Graig, the house in the rock}- was the site of a secret printing press where a Welsh catechism {"Athrawiaith {Cristionogol" }was printed. The cave is still there; the Pugh family have gone; Penrhyn Old Hall is now a nightclub and the little chapel is in ruins.
